SENT.plain: Dementia is characterised by progressive memory loss, associated with agnosia, aphasia, dyscalculia, apraxia, and deficits in executive functioning
Alzheimer disease is the most frequent cause of dementia, with vascular dementia, diffuse Lewy body disease, and other etiologies being important differential diagnoses
A strategy and diagnostic hierarchy for diagnosis in dementia is proposed
Diagnostic criteria for Alzheimer disease, diffuse Lewy body disease, and vascular dementia are discussed
